title: Everglades National Park: Going Green
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial     Going Green              Going Green           Solar arrays provide hot water at Flamingo campgrounds. NPS Photo  At the Flamingo campgrounds in Everglades National Park, solar powered heaters are used to provide hot water for showers.         Solar light at the Ernest Coe Visitor Center parking lot. NPS Photo            In the visitor center parking lot, solar power is used to light the lot when dark. This is a great opportunity to harness renewable energy in Everglades.        Eco Tent Flamingo NPS Photo  Semi-permanent structures, or Eco-Tents, are planned for the Flamingo campsites in Everglades. It is possible that these tents will be equipped with solar powered lights, and even fans or outlets.
